pli-tv-bu-vb-ss11:0.3: The chapter on offenses entailing suspension
pli-tv-bu-vb-ss11:0.4: 11. The training rule on supporting a schism
pli-tv-bu-vb-ss11:1.1: At one time the Buddha was staying at Rājagaha in the Bamboo Grove, the squirrel sanctuary.
pli-tv-bu-vb-ss11:1.2: At that time Devadatta was pursuing schism in the Sangha, a break in transmission.
pli-tv-bu-vb-ss11:1.4: “Devadatta speaks contrary to the Teaching and the training.
pli-tv-bu-vb-ss11:1.5: How can he pursue schism in the Sangha?”
pli-tv-bu-vb-ss11:1.6: But Kokālika, Kaṭamodakatissaka, Khaṇḍadeviyā-putta, and Samuddadatta said to those monks,
pli-tv-bu-vb-ss11:1.8: Devadatta does speak in accordance with the Teaching and the training.
pli-tv-bu-vb-ss11:1.9: And he speaks with our consent and approval. He knows about us and speaks for us, and we approve of this.”
pli-tv-bu-vb-ss11:1.10: The monks of few desires complained and criticized them,
pli-tv-bu-vb-ss11:1.11: “How can these monks support Devadatta’s pursuit of schism in the Sangha?”
pli-tv-bu-vb-ss11:1.12: They rebuked those monks in many ways and then told the Buddha. Soon afterwards he had the Sangha gathered and questioned the monks:
pli-tv-bu-vb-ss11:1.13: “Is it true, monks, that some monks support Devadatta’s pursuit of schism in the Sangha?”
pli-tv-bu-vb-ss11:1.16: “… Monks, how can those foolish men support Devadatta’s pursuit of schism in the Sangha?
pli-tv-bu-vb-ss11:1.17: This won’t give rise to confidence in those without it …
pli-tv-bu-vb-ss11:1.18: And, monks, this training rule should be recited like this:
pli-tv-bu-vb-ss11:1.19.1: ‘That monk may have one, two, or three monks who side with him and support him, and they may say,
pli-tv-bu-vb-ss11:1.21: He speaks in accordance with the Teaching and the training.
pli-tv-bu-vb-ss11:1.22: And he speaks with our consent and acceptance. He knows about us and speaks for us, and we approve of this.”
pli-tv-bu-vb-ss11:1.23: The monks should correct those monks,
pli-tv-bu-vb-ss11:1.25: this monk speaks contrary to the Teaching and the training.
pli-tv-bu-vb-ss11:1.26: Don’t consent to schism in the Sangha.
pli-tv-bu-vb-ss11:1.27: Stay with the Sangha, for a united Sangha—in concord, in harmony, having a joint recitation—is at ease.”
pli-tv-bu-vb-ss11:1.28: If those monks still continue as before, the monks should press them up to three times to make them stop.
pli-tv-bu-vb-ss11:1.29: If they then stop, all is well.
pli-tv-bu-vb-ss11:1.30: If they do not stop, they commit an offense entailing suspension.’”
pli-tv-bu-vb-ss11:2.2: that monk who is pursuing schism in the Sangha.
pli-tv-bu-vb-ss11:2.6: they have the same view, the same belief, the same persuasion as he does.
pli-tv-bu-vb-ss11:2.8: they praise him and take his side.
pli-tv-bu-vb-ss11:2.10: There is one, or two, or three. They may say,
pli-tv-bu-vb-ss11:2.11: “Venerables, don’t correct this monk. He speaks in accordance with the Teaching and the training.
pli-tv-bu-vb-ss11:2.12: And he speaks with our consent and acceptance. He knows about us and speaks for us, and we approve of this.”
pli-tv-bu-vb-ss11:2.14: those monks who side with him.
pli-tv-bu-vb-ss11:2.16: Other monks, those who see it or hear about it. They should correct them like this:
pli-tv-bu-vb-ss11:2.18: this monk speaks contrary to the Teaching and the training.
pli-tv-bu-vb-ss11:2.19: Don’t consent to schism in the Sangha.
pli-tv-bu-vb-ss11:2.21: for a united Sangha—in concord, in harmony, having a joint recitation—is at ease.”

pli-tv-bu-vb-ss11:2.24: If they stop, all is well.
pli-tv-bu-vb-ss11:2.25: If they do not stop, they commit an offense of wrong conduct.
pli-tv-bu-vb-ss11:2.26: If those who hear about it do not say anything, they commit an offense of wrong conduct.
pli-tv-bu-vb-ss11:2.27: Those monks, even if they have to be pulled into the Sangha, should be corrected like this:
pli-tv-bu-vb-ss11:2.29: this monk speaks contrary to the Teaching and the training.
pli-tv-bu-vb-ss11:2.30: Don’t consent to schism in the Sangha.
pli-tv-bu-vb-ss11:2.32: for a united Sangha—in concord, in harmony, having a joint recitation—is at ease.”

pli-tv-bu-vb-ss11:2.38: “And, monks, they should be pressed like this.
pli-tv-bu-vb-ss11:2.39: A competent and capable monk should inform the Sangha:
pli-tv-bu-vb-ss11:2.40: ‘Please, Venerables, I ask the Sangha to listen.
pli-tv-bu-vb-ss11:2.41: Monks so-and-so and so-and-so are siding with him and supporting monk so-and-so who is pursuing schism in the Sangha.
pli-tv-bu-vb-ss11:2.42: They are not stopping that activity.
pli-tv-bu-vb-ss11:2.43: If it seems appropriate to the Sangha, the Sangha should press them to make them stop.
pli-tv-bu-vb-ss11:2.45: Please, Venerables, I ask the Sangha to listen.
pli-tv-bu-vb-ss11:2.46: Monks so-and-so and so-and-so are siding with and supporting monk so-and-so who is pursuing schism in the Sangha.
pli-tv-bu-vb-ss11:2.47: They are not stopping that activity.
pli-tv-bu-vb-ss11:2.48: The Sangha presses them to make them stop.
pli-tv-bu-vb-ss11:2.49: Any monk who approves of pressing them to make them stop should remain silent.
pli-tv-bu-vb-ss11:2.50: Any monk who does not approve should speak up.
pli-tv-bu-vb-ss11:2.52: For the third time I speak on this matter:
pli-tv-bu-vb-ss11:2.53: Please, Venerables, I ask the Sangha to listen.
pli-tv-bu-vb-ss11:2.54: Monks so-and-so and so-and-so are siding with and supporting monk so-and-so who is pursuing schism in the Sangha.
pli-tv-bu-vb-ss11:2.55: They are not stopping that activity.
pli-tv-bu-vb-ss11:2.56: The Sangha presses them to make them stop.
pli-tv-bu-vb-ss11:2.57: Any monk who approves of pressing them to make them stop should remain silent.
pli-tv-bu-vb-ss11:2.58: Any monk who does not approve should speak up.
pli-tv-bu-vb-ss11:2.59: The Sangha has pressed monks so-and-so and so-and-so to stop that activity.
pli-tv-bu-vb-ss11:2.60: The Sangha approves and is therefore silent.
pli-tv-bu-vb-ss11:2.62: After the motion, they commit an offense of wrong conduct.
pli-tv-bu-vb-ss11:2.63: After each of the first two announcements, they commit a serious offense.
pli-tv-bu-vb-ss11:2.64: When the last announcement is finished, they commit an offense entailing suspension.
pli-tv-bu-vb-ss11:2.65: For those who commit the offense entailing suspension, the offense of wrong conduct and the serious offenses are annulled.
pli-tv-bu-vb-ss11:2.66: Two or three may be pressed together, but not more than that.
pli-tv-bu-vb-ss11:2.67: They commit an offense entailing suspension:
pli-tv-bu-vb-ss11:2.68: … Therefore, too, it is called “an offense entailing suspension”.
pli-tv-bu-vb-ss11:3.1.1: If it is a legitimate legal procedure, and they perceive it as such, but they do not stop, they commit an offense entailing suspension.
pli-tv-bu-vb-ss11:3.1.2: If it is a legitimate legal procedure, but they are unsure of it, and they do not stop, they commit an offense entailing suspension.
pli-tv-bu-vb-ss11:3.1.3: If it is a legitimate legal procedure, but they perceive it as illegitimate, and they do not stop, they commit an offense entailing suspension.
pli-tv-bu-vb-ss11:3.1.4: If it is an illegitimate legal procedure, but they perceive it as legitimate, they commit an offense of wrong conduct.
pli-tv-bu-vb-ss11:3.1.5: If it is an illegitimate legal procedure, but they are unsure of it, they commit an offense of wrong conduct.
pli-tv-bu-vb-ss11:3.1.6: If it is an illegitimate legal procedure, and they perceive it as such, they commit an offense of wrong conduct.

pli-tv-bu-vb-ss11:3.2.6: if they are overwhelmed by pain;
pli-tv-bu-vb-ss11:3.2.7: if they are the first offenders.
pli-tv-bu-vb-ss11:3.2.8: The eleventh rule, the training rule on siding with a schism, is finished.
